content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL RULE: Only check PRs authored by Bill (BillChirico) or by Pip Build / sub-agents. Do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else (other contributors, bots like coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill has explicitly told you to.

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs. Skip everything else.
3) For eligible PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Tuesday, February 17th, 2026 ‚Äî 2:04 PM (America/New_York)

OpenClaw users get bonus widgets (auth status, cron jobs, activity logs), but they're completely optional.

The built-in agent service targets OpenClaw ‚Äî PRs welcome for adapters to other platforms.

/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-13-0425.md:34:[#20](https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/20) `feat/moderation-commands-v2` is clean ‚Äî 9 commits across 2 rounds, all 545 tests passing (92% coverage), no merge conflicts. Ready for another review cycle or merge whenever AnExiledDev / you are happy with it.
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:1:# 2026-02-10 ‚Äî Pip Build Session Notes
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:7:Bill's DMs to the **Pip** Discord bot (ID: `1466213865397162150`) were being routed to the **build** agent instead of the **main** agent. Bill kept getting Pip Build when he expected Pip.
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:11:1. **Build agent missing `workspace` config** ‚Äî `agents.list` only had `{id: "build", model: {...}}` with no `workspace` field. It inherited `agents.defaults.workspace` (`/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace`) which is Pip main's workspace. Fix: added `"workspace": "/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build"` to the build agent entry.
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:13:2. **Main agent not in `agents.list`** ‚Äî Only `build` was explicitly listed. The binding `{agentId: "main", match: {channel: "discord", accountId: "pip"}}` couldn't resolve because `main` wasn't in the agents list. The gateway fell back to the first (only) listed agent: `build`. Fix: added `{id: "main", default: true, workspace: "/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace"}` to `agents.list`.

/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:7:Bill's DMs to the **Pip** Discord bot (ID: `1466213865397162150`) were being routed to the **build** agent instead of the **main** agent. Bill kept getting Pip Build when he expected Pip.
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:11:1. **Build agent missing `workspace` config** ‚Äî `agents.list` only had `{id: "build", model: {...}}` with no `workspace` field. It inherited `agents.defaults.workspace` (`/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace`) which is Pip main's workspace. Fix: added `"workspace": "/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build"` to the build agent entry.
/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/memory/2026-02-10.md:13:2. **Main agent not in `agents.list`** ‚Äî Only `build` was explicitly listed. The binding `{agentId: "main", match: {channel: "discord", accountId: "pip"}}` couldn't resolve because `main` wasn't in the agents list. The gateway fell back to the first (only) listed agent: `build`. Fix: added `{id: "main", default: true, workspace: "/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace"}` to `agents.list`.

arguments.command:
for pr in 74 73; do
  gh api graphql -f owner='BillChirico' -f name='bills-bot' -F number=$pr -f query='query($owner:String!,$name:String!,$number:Int!){repository(owner:$owner,name:$name){pullRequest(number:$number){number title url reviewThreads(first:100){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line originalLine startLine originalStartLine diffSide comments(first:20){nodes{author{login}body url createdAt}}}}}}}' > /tmp/pr_${pr}_threads.json
  echo "saved $pr"
done
jq '.data.repository.pullRequest | {number,title,unresolved:(.reviewThreads.nodes|map(select(.isResolved==false))|length)}' /tmp/pr_74_threads.json /tmp/pr_73_threads.json

  echo "saved $pr"
done
jq '.data.repository.pullRequest | {number,title,unresolved:(.reviewThreads.nodes|map(select(.isResolved==false))|length)}' /tmp/pr_74_threads.json /tmp/pr_73_threads.json"}

content.name: exec

arguments.command:
python - <<'PY'
import json,subprocess,sys
prs=[74,73]
for pr in prs:
    q='query($owner:String!,$name:String!,$number:Int!){repository(owner:$owner,name:$name){pullRequest(number:$number){number title url reviewThreads(first:100){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line originalLine startLine originalStartLine diffSide comments(first:20){nodes{author{login}body url createdAt}}}}}}}'
    out=subprocess.check_output(['gh','api','graphql','-f','owner=BillChirico','-f','name=bills-bot','-F',f'number={pr}','-f',f'query={q}'],text=True)
    data=json.loads(out)['data']['repository']['pullRequest']
    unresolved=[t for t in data['reviewThreads']['nodes'] if not t['isResolved']]
    print(json.dumps({'number':data['number'],'title':data['title'],'url':data['url'],'unresolved_count':len(unresolved)},ensure_ascii=False))
PY
